document.docAuthor: Guimarães, Jorge A., Gallardo, Fabiana E., Diaz, Norma Beatriz & Zucchi, Roberto A.
document.masterDocTitle: Eucoilinae species (Hymenoptera: Cynipoidea: Figitidae) parasitoids of fruit­infesting dipterous larvae in Brazil: identity, geographical distribution and host associations

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Eucoilinae species (Hymenoptera: Cynipoidea: Figitidae) parasitoids of fruit­infesting dipterous larvae in Brazil: identity, geographical distribution and host associations

bibRefCitation.author: Borgmeier
bibRefCitation.refString: Borgmeier, T. (1935) Sobre alguns cynipideos parasiticos e cecidogenos do Brasil (Hymenoptera: Cynipidae). Archivos do Instituto de Biologia Vegetal, 2 (1), 97 - 124.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Hosts. Tephritidae :
Anastrepha fraterculus
( in
Borgmeier 1935
),
Anastrepha
spp. and
Ceratitis capitata
( in
Wharton et al . 1981
;
Guimarães et al . 1999
). Lonchaeidae :
Neosilba pendula
( in
Costa Lima 1940
).

Wharton et al. ( 1998 )
suggested that
O . anastrephae
may be a parasitoid rather of tephritids than of other dipterous. Most of the material estudied herein was obtained from Tephritidae puparia in Myrtaceae .

Remarks .
Odontosema
Kieffer, 1909
is represented by two neotropical species:
O . albinerve
Kieffer, 1909
and
O . anastrephae
. The specimens studied of these species show that the morphological differences between them could be only individual variations.

Material collected. BRAZIL . Amazonas: Manaus,
27 .XII. 1991
, (
1 male
), coll. N. M. Silva. Mato Grosso do Sul: Terenos,
14 .V. 1993
, (

,

, (

), coll. M.A. Uchôa. ( ESALQ ). São Paulo: São Bento do Sapucaí,

), coll. L.A.B. Salles. ( ESALQ and MLP ).
